p: EV infections are also reported to cause paralysis along with encephalitis [ 17]. Before May 2018, Japanese surveillance lacked diagnosis and surveillance for AFP cases; therefore, during the AFP outbreak of 2015, an additional epidemiological survey based on notification from the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare was conducted [ 33]. Although EV-D68 has been suspected as a significant contributor of AFP cases [ 42], the association with paralysis makes EV-A71 the current major AFP pathogen [ 43].
